channel.title: Is the UN justified?
channel.description: Ought such an organization have so much power?

item.title: Is the UN justified?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:72, topic:384560”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=480323.msg3542661#msg3542661 date=1300980898]

If the US vetoes something, you really think the little countries are going to do it? No.

Wait what?
[/quote]
Think about it… if the UN has a proposal or something and the US or other larger powers choose not to participate is it going to have the same effect?[/quote]
Nothing other than the fact those small countries won’t have to participate. Not that they have to anyway, and I don’t think any country would actually do anything to stop them. That was what I meant when I said the UN doesn’t have enough power to enforce the resolutions they want happening.

[quote=“Lothy, post:73, topic:384560”]Big countries should always have the right to veto something. Whether or not they’re prepared to in the face of potential repercussions depends.
The reality is that not many countries can successfully place sanctions on the US without doing more damage to themselves. On the other hand, when the US places a sanction on someone it is crippling.
That’s just how the world works for big countries.

Also, why shouldn’t the US/UK/etc sometimes say no? Being a member of the UN does not override state sovereignty. They’re still at liberty, as individual countries, to do whatever they please at the end of the day.

A lot of scope creep has occurred with the UN since its inception. Specifically, the original goal of the UN was to stop a third world war… After doing it twice, most countries realised that there were probably alternatives.[/quote]
That may be true, however there should be a major, unbiased power governing the world as to allow equality on all of the decisions. My view of this would be something like the elections but on a bigger scale, with representatives from all over the world discussing their country’s problems, proposing solutions and ending up with a vote to see how many people want to go through.

Read full topic

item.title: Is the UN justified?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Big countries should always have the right to veto something. Whether or not they’re prepared to in the face of potential repercussions depends.
The reality is that not many countries can successfully place sanctions on the US without doing more damage to themselves. On the other hand, when the US places a sanction on someone it is crippling.
That’s just how the world works for big countries.

Also, why shouldn’t the US/UK/etc sometimes say no? Being a member of the UN does not override state sovereignty. They’re still at liberty, as individual countries, to do whatever they please at the end of the day.

A lot of scope creep has occurred with the UN since its inception. Specifically, the original goal of the UN was to stop a third world war… After doing it twice, most countries realised that there were probably alternatives.

Read full topic

item.title: Is the UN justified?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

From what little history I know, I’d say the UN doesn’t have enough power, rather the powerful countries just ignore any resolutions they don’t want to follow. Also the whole ‘veto right’ (correct me if I spelt it incorrectly, it’s a direct translation) practically makes the UN void. The way I see it, the whole purpse of the UN is supposedly so the whole world can have a say in the global decisions, but in reality when a major country doesn’t want something to happen it’s automatically nulled because they don’t want it going.

Read full topic

item.title: Is the UN justified?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:63, topic:384560”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=480323.msg3527204#msg3527204 date=1299922302]
Not having it can also be problematic, since it is best to have the big countries agreeing on important decisions. Just strip France and UK for the Veto-rights.
[/quote]

Yea, just leave the veto-ing to Russia, China, and the US. Those are three countries that won’t abuse those powers…[/quote]
Because it won’t get well if they get in trouble with each other. France and UK are more civil countries, and UN can do more if the Veto-ing get restricted. But still let France and UK keep their permanent membership in the security council.

Thug-life: UNs power is based on its members power. If you don’t get the great powers with you, UN is powerless.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Bowser jr:

Not having it can also be problematic, since it is best to have the big countries agreeing on important decisions. Just strip France and UK for the Veto-rights.

Yea, just leave the veto-ing to Russia, China, and the US. Those are three countries that won’t abuse those powers…

item.title: Is the UN justified?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:61, topic:384560”][quote author=Radeon link=topic=480323.msg3527180#msg3527180 date=1299919206]
The veto-power makes the whole UN illegitimate. Every time the US is the only country to veto a vote to stop Israel from committing atrocities I get frustrated. It’s usually the whole world voting in favour of taking action except Israel and the US.
[/quote]
Not having it can also be problematic, since it is best to have the big countries agreeing on important decisions. Just strip France and UK for the Veto-rights.[/quote]

That doesn’t make sense at all. Why should the big countries have all the power, isn’t that part of the reason for the UN? It gives the entire world a say in world issues?

But then you go and say two of the biggest military and economic powers in the world, France and the UK should have their VETO rights removed? Sounds like you don’t get the UN.

Read full topic

item.title: Is the UN justified?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Radeon:

The veto-power makes the whole UN illegitimate. Every time the US is the only country to veto a vote to stop Israel from committing atrocities I get frustrated. It’s usually the whole world voting in favour of taking action except Israel and the US.

Not having it can also be problematic, since it is best to have the big countries agreeing on important decisions. Just strip France and UK for the Veto-rights.

Read full topic
